articles.title: Elon Musk's xAI sues Apple and OpenAI over AI competition
articles.content: Elon Musk's xAI seeks billions in damages from Apple and OpenAI for allegedly “perpetrating their anticompetitive scheme"

articles.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Drops, Apple Firm Despite Musk Threat; Cathie Wood Loads Up On This Stock (Live Coverage)
articles.content: The Dow fell as Nvidia shined on the stock market today. Apple held up despite an Elon Musk AI move. Cathie Wood bought a diving stock.

articles.title: Elon Musk's X & xAI sue Apple & Open AI: What happens next?
articles.content: X (formerly Twitter) and xAI (XAAI.PVT), owned by Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk, are suing Apple (AAPL) and OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). Musk's companies allege that Apple and OpenAI's partnership is anti-competitive and that the government should intervene due to antitrust laws. Yahoo Finance Senior Legal Reporter Alexis Keenan outlines the details of the suit. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

articles.title: Why Apple Stock Could Sell Off After iPhone 17 Reveal
articles.content: Apple stock could sell off after the company announces its iPhone 17 series smartphones next month, a Wall Street analyst said Monday.

articles.title: Apple's Biggest iPhone Overhaul in a Decade Could Redefine the Stock's Next Growth Cycle
articles.content: Three years, three redesigns, foldables, AI-powered Siri, and a $100B services pivot -- Apple's next chapter begins.

articles.title: Apple no longer innovates — it waits. And with AI, anyone playing it safe will get left behind.

articles.title: Inside Elon Musk's suit against Apple and OpenAI: 'This is a tale of two monopolists'
articles.content: Elon Musk followed through on Monday with a warning to sue Apple and OpenAI over their agreement to integrate OpenAI’s chatbot into Apple’s operating systems and prioritize the chatbot in its app store.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s xAI Sues Apple and OpenAI, Alleging They Are Monopolists
articles.content: Musk said the partnership between the two companies has given the ChatGPT-maker access to “billions of user prompts.”
